title: Alex Rodriguez looks sharp in a down jacket as he models for Dick's Sporting Goods
text:
As a former Major League Baseball player and current Fox Sports analyst, it is only fitting that he partner with an active-wear brand.

And on Wednesday, Alex Rodriguez walked in his first ever fashion show, as he took the runway for Dick's Sporting Goods in NYC.

The 44-year-old took to Instagram to share a video highlight of his night, and noted that his daughters were 'proud that I didn't embarrass myself.

On Wednesday, Alex Rodriguez walked in his first ever fashion show, as he took the runway for Dick's Sporting Goods in NYC.

'From the field, to the streets, to the boardroom, more athletes are leading the way in setting fashion trends than ever before,' he began.

'Had a blast walking in @dickssportinggoods (and my) first ever fashion show. While I would have liked a few more pinstripes, all the Fall and Winter looks were [fire] ……and my girls are proud I didn't embarrass myself #ad.'

The sports legend looked sharp in a plaid button-down, track pants and a down jacket.

Handsome: The sports legend looked sharp in a plaid button-down, track pants, down jacket and boots

Joining Alex on the runway were several other notable faces; boxer and actor Javon 'Wanna' Walton, Bachelor in Paradise star Demi Burnett, 24, and soccer star Carli Lloyd, 37

Stylish: Two-time Olympic gold medalist Carli sported a rose-colored, two piece sweater and legging set. Demi looked stylish in a fitted top layered underneath a brown hoodie and down jacket. Javon wore a T-shirt, red hoodie, shorts, socks and sneakers

Joining Alex on the runway were several other notable faces.

Two-time Olympic gold medalist Carli Lloyd, 37, sported a rose-colored, two piece sweater and legging set. The soccer star bundled up beneath an extra long, white down jacket.

Bachelor in Paradise star, Demi Burnett, looked stylish in a fitted top layered underneath a brown hoodie and down jacket. The 24-year-old's look was paired with print leggings, thick socks and snow boots.

Boxer and actor Javon 'Wanna' Walton was styled casually in a T-shirt, red hoodie, shorts, socks and sneakers.

The cool kids: The crowd watched in awe as the models walked down the runway

In an interview with WWD, the father-of-two, who admits to being a Dick's 'customer for a long time' spoke on their decision in support of gun control.

The company has removed assault rifles from their stores, have destroyed $5 million worth of the firearms, and have increased the age limit to purchase guns to 21, according to WWD.

'I’m aware of what they’ve done. Look, any time someone takes a position where they’re going to take social good over the bottom line, it is a good thing,' he began.

'I’m the father of two beautiful daughters and the stepfather of two beautiful twins. I’m proud of what they’re doing.'
description: On Wednesday, Alex Rodriguez, 44, walked in his first ever fashion show, as he took the runway for Dick's Sporting Goods in NYC. This marks the first show for both himself and the brand.
